title: Internationalisation of innovation and business excellence

author: Nenad Savič, UNIKATUM, inštitut za inovativne poslovne modele

segmentation: Hello to everybody from my site.
I am director of Small Company unique Ottoman.
The president of Slovenian Foundation for Business Excellence.
So in my presentation I will in phases the big business excellence view to the innovation to the Internet, internationalization of innovation.
In background of this title, I see I saw a key question how to succeed with innovation in global or or in international markets and if business excellence could support that.
And Furthermore if the answer is yes, how?

So from the viewpoint of economy, success is when the company is more competitive than competitors are anwen or more money an from the earning money means not just by performing a valuable tasks, but by being different from competitors and in a manner that the server core customer better and more profitability.
So it doesn't matter in my presentation in which kind of innovation we could, we will talk or I will speak.
I will not go deeply into any type of innovation.
The idea is that each of these innovation should produce some value, some shared value.
So.
Nowadays, a concept of shared value is even more frequently used.
And is defined as benefit benefits relative.
Not just benefits.
Relative to the people who are involved in that relative to an environment relative to society or relative to.
To the social social elements of of being.
So in if we look at the results area of excellence model.
All those elements which I mentioned before which are part of shared.
Value already in the elements of those.
Those model business excellence model.
So we have the four elements for area people.
Results customer results.
SoC results and the main part of key results which are divided and split into key strategic outcomes and key performance indicators.
This excellence model has been developed by European Foundation for Quality Management.
Around 20 years ago.
So that elements still exist and a lot of experience among the companies are already.
Achieved and especially use you hurt in the morning session.
Learn to son who is from Phillips and Phillips was one of the founder who established the FOMO and as well that model.
And on the results part of this model innovation is reflected in each of this area we could find here.
Some different results.
Who with this results are used from different organization too.
Present how good they are on the feeling on the field of innovation.
Um, for example, income of as a result of selling of new or innovative products in Slovenia.
In many cases I hurt the targets, for example from the Trimmer company from the Collector company from the Kayles Company.
That 30% is the target in that particular results, so income of results of selling new and innovative projects.
Why I'm why I'm showing this becausw?
Each of these results.
Each of these different type of results and the the measure which which we use.
Say it's not shared all over the organization, each organization mostly used the one which they used the most.
The most applicable for them, but based on on the tree.
Sites to the approach of rather assessment.
We assess excellence in organization, so each of our results are splitting different levels on performance and relevance and usability levels and then we have several elements which we observe.
Maybe the the trends from the performance area.
The trends means that excellence organization demonstrate positive or sustained good results over at least three years period.
The clear targets means for key results based on the needs and expectations of their customer in line with their chosen strategy, where innovations incorporated.
Understanding how the results are.
Achieved and compared to similar organization and organization use this data.
Relevant again for target settings.

And the next element causes means that organizations should clearly understand the underlying conditions and drivers of observed trends as the impact of these trends will have on the other performance indicators.
Oh European Foundation for quality management as well as well as Slovenian Foundation for quality for business excellence, we have the approach how to assess excellence.
But I think the very good idea came from Phillips Company where they developed 1010 steps, elements 10 steps of assessing from zero to the most maturity model.
And very interesting is very interesting is that on the level 789 and 10.
Could achieve only if you are compatible to the best in class companies.
Best in the world.
Companies and Phillips clearly defined all processes and defined on each step.
What needs to achieve and on the very high level they achieved best in class?
Elements.
So excellent FM excellence model is divided into 2 parts and one part.
One part is result parts and the other parts are.
Enabler parts, but the strategy is the domain elements.
We assess how the organization put the strategy, how organization involved into the strategy the innovation process is, and the results of that strategy are then on the results.
Parts presented.
But strategy is not could not be performed.
Other other way than through the processes and process is could not be work well if we do not involved in people with knowledge and other partners and resources.
So these are the elements of the model and the last element is that leadership, how the organization, how the leaders in organization lead and manage hold organization.
Home.
All these elements 9 elements could be could be understand as a mirror, so we look at the organization through the nine different mirrors and we saw the reality inside the company.
Further on each element are many questions which we need to answer to the assessment, but this is not the element of the.
Presentation.
So.
The whole model, if we look on.
18 and we use it to assess internationalization of innovation or use in innovation from different perspective.
We always should look then to the result parts and find if they achieve target performance and what kind of gap we find and through the root cause.
Analysis analyzes learning and we are going to the change what we're doing.
So for the end, I would like to say that definition which are behind this model is that excellent.
Organize excellent organizations achieve and sustain superior levels of performance that meet or exceed the expectation of all their stakeholders stakeholders.
And.

The elements of different innovation process is now if we put it into the model, we briefly see that we could assess and find if they work successfully, efficiently and in accordance with the targets which they have been made.
Thank you very much.
